title: Electric PE - three point charges on a line

content.question: Two point charges of opposite sign, <math alttext="negative Q sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mpadded></math> and <math alttext="positive Q sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mpadded></math>, are fixed in place a distance <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math> apart from each other, as shown in the figure, while a third point charge with positive charge <math alttext="positive Q sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mpadded></math> is initially located a long distance away on the line joining <math alttext="negative Q sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mpadded></math> and <math alttext="positive Q sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mpadded></math>. An external force moves point charge <math alttext="positive Q sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mpadded></math> along the line until it is in its final position a distance <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math> to the right of <math alttext="positive Q sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mpadded></math>. Which of the following claims is true during the time that point charge <math alttext="positive Q sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mpadded></math> is being moved from its initial position to its final position?

choices.label: The work done by point charge <math alttext="positive Q sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mpadded></math> on point charge <math alttext="positive Q sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mpadded></math> is positive.
The work done by the external force on point charge <math alttext="positive Q sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mpadded></math> is zero.

The electric potential energy of the <math alttext="negative Q sub 0, positive Q sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mpadded><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mpadded></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mpadded><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mpadded></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> system becomes higher.

The electric potential energy of the <math alttext="negative Q sub 0, positive Q sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mpadded><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mpadded></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mpadded><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mpadded></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> system becomes lower.
